action.action-desc: Mr. McKinley introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require the Comptroller General to conduct a study of the interoperability of computer systems used by hospitals to store and access electronic health records, and for other purposes.

section.header: Study on interoperability of computer systems used by hospitals to store and access electronic health records

subsection.text: The Comptroller General shall conduct a study of the interoperability of computer systems used by hospitals to store and access electronic health records, which shall exploreâ€”

paragraph.text: the identity of hospitals in the United States that use, at the time the study is conducted, computer systems with the ability to allow authorized personnel of more than one hospital to access and update the electronic health records of the same patient;
the reasons why hospitals in the United States do not have computer systems with such ability at the time the study is conducted; and
the extent to which increased interoperability of such computer systems allows hospitals to more effectively coordinate the care of patients.

subsection.text: Not later than 6 months after date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall submit to the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives a report on the study conducted under subsection (a), including such recommendations as the Comptroller General considers appropriate regarding the use of interoperable computer systems by hospitals to store and access electronic health records as a method of improving the coordination of care of patients.
